definition: Roosevelt (name)/Theodore Roosevelt (1858-1919), US President 1901-1909/Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882-1945), US President 1933-1945
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]

sentences.english: Roosevelt, avid for war, undertook a desperate gamble.
sentences.chinese: 羅斯福，渴望戰爭，他就此孤注一擲。

sentences.english: Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882-1945) Roosevelt became president in 1933.

sentences.chinese: 但羅斯福成功地再次當選。

sentences.english: F.D.R. was called a lot worse names than socialist.
sentences.chinese: 羅斯福因此被稱作是比社會主義者還“惡劣”的人。

sentences.english: How did F.D.R. manage to make big government so clean?
sentences.chinese: 羅斯福如何讓大政府如此廉潔？

sentences.english: The Roosevelt family poses for the camera two years after moving into the White House.
sentences.chinese: 這是羅斯福佳通入住白宮兩年以後的照的相片。

sentences.english: I'll meet you at the intersection of Heping and Roosevelt.
sentences.chinese: 我在和平跟羅斯福路交叉口和你碰面。

sentences.english: This is one of the branches of the Roosevelt family.
sentences.chinese: 這是羅斯福家族的一個支系。

sentences.english: They named them after Roosevelt's nickname Teddy.
sentences.chinese: 他們給玩具熊起名爲羅斯福泰迪。

sentences.english: After consolidating his position, F.D.R. opened the New Deal floodgates.
sentences.chinese: 地位得到鞏固之後，羅斯福打開了新政的閘門。

sentences.english: Roosevelt and Hull both replied in words that scarcely concealed their disgust.
sentences.chinese: 羅斯福和赫爾的答詞，幾乎沒有隱藏他們的憎惡之情。

sentences.english: In return, FDR offered to stop interfering in Asian affairs altogether.
sentences.chinese: 作爲回報，羅斯福答應完全不再插手亞洲事務。

sentences.english: Roosevelt's wartime diplomacy was closely linked with its non-colonial principle thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 羅斯福的戰時外交與非殖民思想緊密相連。

sentences.english: FDR and Henry, Jr . reminisced about the old days over lunch.
sentences.chinese: 小亨利和羅斯福一邊共進午餐，一邊追敘昔日的生活。

sentences.english: The live webcast will come to you from Roosevelt Hospital in New York City.
sentences.chinese: 紐約市羅斯福醫院將向您發送網上直播。

sentences.english: At the series of meetings in Cairo, Roosevelt outlined his vision for postwar Asia.
sentences.chinese: 開羅之系列會議中，羅斯福爲戰後之亞洲勾勒願景。

definition: Brooklyn, borough of New York City

pinyin: Bin1 xi1 fa3 ni2 ya4 zhou1

definition: Queens, one of the five boroughs of New York City
